content:
lass="word-wrap-span">AMERICA IS IN the lass="word-wrap-span">grip of a health scare over e-cigarettes. At least seven people have died and around 380 are suffering from a mysterious lung disease linked to vaping. In response, national and local lawmakers are restricting e-cigarettes. On lass="word-wrap-span">September 11th the lass="word-wrap-span">Trump administration said it would ban the sale of most flavoured e-cigarettes. lass="word-wrap-span">Michigan and lass="word-wrap-span">New York have announced similar bans. On lass="word-wrap-span">September 16th lass="word-wrap-span">California’s governor signed an lass="word-wrap-span">executive order regulating e-cigarette sales. lass="word-wrap-span">Hundreds of municipalities and at least 18 states already have e-cigarette laws on the lass="word-wrap-span">books (see map).

lass="word-wrap-span">Concern over vaping has been growing for years. lass="word-wrap-span">Much of it has focused on teenagers, more and more of whom are warming to the habit. In 2018, according to an annual survey by the lass="word-wrap-span">National lass="word-wrap-span">Institute on lass="word-wrap-span">Drug lass="word-wrap-span">Abuse, more than one in ten eighth-lass="word-wrap-span">graders (mainly 12- to 14-year-olds) said they vaped nicotine in the past year. lass="word-wrap-span">Among high-school seniors (aged 17 to 18) the figure was 37%. lass="word-wrap-span">Nearly 21% reported vaping in the past 30 lass="word-wrap-span">days, up from 11% the previous year. lass="word-wrap-span">This was the largest single-year increase in the use of any substance in the survey’s 44-year history.

Juul lass="word-wrap-span">Labs, an e-cigarette company in San lass="word-wrap-span">Francisco, is regulators’ most prominent target. On lass="word-wrap-span">September 9th the lass="word-wrap-span">Food and lass="word-wrap-span">Drug lass="word-wrap-span">Administration warned the company against marketing its flavoured products to children. Juul is also being sued in lass="word-wrap-span">Illinois, where a local prosecutor accuses it of using “lass="word-wrap-span">deceptive” marketing aimed at teenagers. lass="word-wrap-span">last year the firm agreed to stop selling its sweet flavours, such as mango and lass="word-wrap-span">cucumber, in bricks-and-mortar stores. Its troubles are not limited to lass="word-wrap-span">lass="word-wrap-span">America. lass="word-wrap-span">Days after launching its products in lass="word-wrap-span">China, the world’s largest cigarette market, sales there were halted (Juul did not lass="word-wrap-span">disclose why its products were pulled from e-commerce sites).

lass="word-wrap-span">Regulatory scrutiny of vaping is welcome: e-cigarettes are not good for your health. lass="word-wrap-span">Marketing aimed at children is plainly unacceptable. lass="word-wrap-span">But lass="word-wrap-span">Banning them may not be the answer. Vaping is still preferable to smoking, which kills 450,000 lass="word-wrap-span">lass="word-wrap-span">Americans a year and 7m people worldwide. lass="word-wrap-span">Bans may only push people to buy e-cigarettes from lass="word-wrap-span">illicit vendors—which are more likely to make them ill. lass="word-wrap-span">lass="word-wrap-span">America should perhaps look instead to the lass="word-wrap-span">European lass="word-wrap-span">Union, which limits the amount of nicotine e-cigarettes can contain. It should also consider its past successes. In 2018 only 4% of high-school seniors said they smoked conventional cigarettes lass="word-wrap-span">daily, down from 22% in 1998. lass="word-wrap-span">Plenty can be lass="word-wrap-span">gleaned from lass="word-wrap-span">lass="word-wrap-span">America’s anti-smoking efforts in the intervening years.

‘What day is it today?’ ‘Monday.’
“今天星期几？”“星期一。”
We're going away in a few days/in a few days' time .
我们过几天就要离开了。

他们前天就走了。

我们后天要见面。

每日服药三次。
We can't go there today. You can go another day .
我们今天不能去那儿。你可以改天去。

白天一直阳光明媚。
I could sit and watch the river all day long .
我可以整天坐在这里看那条河。

他晚上干活，白天睡觉。
Nocturnal animals sleep by day and hunt by night.

你这一天过得顺利吗？
